meanings.meaning: Basically this means that there is a problem with the Mass Air Flow High (MAF) sensor or circuit. A more technical description would be that the MAF circuit had higher than expected voltage (air flow). Other MAF sensor circuit DTC trouble codes are P0100, P0101, P0102, and P0104.

causes.cause: The MAF may be disconnected, or a wiring connection may be bad
The MAF sensor may be damaged
The vehicle computer may be faulty (very rare)

descriptions.description: Mass Air Flow (MAF) Circuit High Input

solutions.solution: Check the voltage of the MAF sensor (refer to a repair manual for vehicle specific information)
Inspect for any air leaks near the MAF sensor.
Take the MAF out and clean it using a spray cleaner such as brake cleaner or electrical contact cleaner. Be gentle with the sensor.
Verify that the Mass Air Flow Sensor wiring is connected properly and that there are no broken / frayed wires.

symptoms.symptom: You will likely not notice any serious drivability problems, although there may be symptoms such as a general decrease in power or sluggishness.
